recommendations.rationale: The instance shows low to moderate CPU utilization (p50=15.2%, p90=28.5%, p95=35.1%) and moderate memory utilization (p50=45.8%, p90=62.3%, p95=71.2%). The m5.large is a general purpose instance with fixed CPU and memory. The t3.large instance provides the same vCPU and memory capacity but uses a burstable CPU model, which is more cost-effective for workloads with moderate CPU usage and occasional spikes. Given the CPU utilization pattern, t3.large can handle the workload while reducing cost by approximately 50%. The workload is production, but the risk is low because t3.large supports unlimited bursting and the memory footprint is unchanged. Network throughput and storage are not bottlenecks here.
implementation_steps: Validate application performance on t3.large in a test environment.
Schedule a maintenance window to stop the current m5.large instance.
Launch a new t3.large instance with the same configuration and attach existing storage.
Monitor CPU and memory utilization closely for 1-2 weeks post-migration.
Rollback to m5.large if performance issues arise.
